DataElement.preferredName: Consent Form Patient Responsible Person Signed Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no/not applicable response to a question related to signature on a document explaining all relevant study information to assist the study volunteer in understanding the expectations and requirements of participation in a clinical trial by patient and person conducting the form discussion.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Consent Form Patient Responsible Person Signed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to signature on a document explaining all relevant study information to assist the study volunteer in understanding the expectations and requirements of participation in a clinical trial by patient and person conducting the form discussion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A document explaining all relevant study information to assist the study volunteer in understanding the expectations and requirements of participation in a clinical trial. This document is presented to and signed by the study subject. (from centerwatch.com glossary)

Concepts.definition: A document explaining all the relevant information to assist an individual in understanding the expectations and risks in making a decision about a procedure. This document is presented to and signed by the individual or guardian.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A person worthy of responsibility or trust or one held accountable.:Signed; having a handwritten signature.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
A person worthy of responsibility or trust or one held accountable.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient with prostate canc
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient with prostate cancer, renal cell cancer, lung cancer, colorectal cancer, soft tissue sarcoma, glioma and thyroid cancer is enrolled in moderate or severe cohort, has patient signed a separate consent form outlining lack of efficacy observed in prior studies and has been consented to the study by a protocol specified designee who is not patients longitudinal oncologist?
